parameters: "Mask"
endcut/MS1
You feel numb and cold. You stagger back inside.\C[14] The mask\C[0]
feels heavy on your face.
You feel weak. You feel weird. You just want to go \C[14]home.
endcut/MS0
Oh. You are back home. Did you walk back? You forget.
People seem to \C[14]ignore you.\c[0] A little rude.
endcut/MS2
You go to your bathroom and look at yourself with that mask
on. It feels so cold. It reminds you of \C[14]something.
When you were eight, back at school, you once told your
teacher something incomprehensible.
You were taking your lunch, and you told her \C[3]'the mask
is very cold.'\C[0] Everyone in class laughed.
Even now, you are telling her again. Or is this the first time?
And - sure enough, \C[5]they all laugh.\C[0]
endcut/MS3
You take one half of your sandwich back with you.
You remember your mom cutting these into triangles.
She is cutting them into triangles now. But you already have
a piece. It's the same piece she is cutting now. You tell her
not to bother cutting it, because \C[14]she's done it already.
This time, the words catch in your throat. You just hover
there behind her, your now countless arms hanging limply.
She turns and \C[5]screams,\C[0] so you disappear. You must have
startled her.
Maybe you need to hide so you don't scare people so much.
You look for some kind of blanket.
You remember that \C[14]big, black blanket\C[0] you had as a teen that
disappeared one day. It was very comfortable. You wonder what
happened to it.
endcut/MS4
Oh, there it is.\. \C[3]How fortunate!
You suppose you never really lost this, you just borrowed
it from yourself.\.\. A terrible headache is coming on.
You wish you could \C[14]apologize to your roommate.\.\C[0] You remember
accusing him of taking it.\. Ah, there he is, talking with you
about a hockey game.
You scared the both of them. It looks like the blanket isn't
quite doing the job. You decide you should follow yourself
around for a bit. Maybe you could \C[14]warn yourself not to go
to the roof.
You start \C[14]following him around. \C[0]You see him everywhere. Here
he is a child. There he is at school. Now he is in the womb. Now
he has a job.
Now he's \C[14]creeping around the apartment building,\C[0] armed.
endcut/MS5
But, for some reason, he seems to be avoiding you. You keep
trying to make contact, but to no avail. Maybe you just look\C[5] too
scary.
You approach him quietly, trying not to startle it.
You struggle to make out his face.
Portrait_PlayerSil
Hello?
Oh. That's a nice surprise. He didn't scream or yelp. You try to
say \C[3]'Hello!'\C[0] back, but nothing comes out.
Portrait_PlayerSil
Stay back!
Ah. He's \C[5]afraid.\C[0] You decide to show you mean no ill will, and
move back a little bit. Give him some space.
\C[14]He doesn't move at all.\C[0] How odd. Is he frozen in fear?\. You
give him a minute to collect himself. He's had a lot on his mind
recently, you remember. Give him a break.
\C[5]He runs away.\C[0] Ahhh\..\..\.. too bad. Maybe you can try reaching out to
him again later.
\C[10]He attacks you!\C[0] Swinging around that \V[865]
like he's never been in a fight before. How silly.
Portrait_PlayerSil
You seem okay...
Things are \C[3]improving\C[0] already.
You are pleased this is going \C[3]so well.
Portrait_PlayerSil
I don't like you...
This reminds you of \C[14]a few converations you've had with a
mirror.\C[0] You try not to think about it too much, or you could
lose track of this moment and end up elsewhere.\C[5] Elsewhen.
Portrait_PlayerSil
You look terrifying.
You look down at where your feet would be.\.\. You really can't help
it. You wish you could look more normal.
Portrait_PlayerSil
What's under the mask?
You look away, a little embarrassed.\. You're not entirely sure
what you look like under there at the moment. Whatever it
could be, it would require a \C[14]lengthy explication,\C[0] and you are
currently \C[5]incapable of speaking.
He leaves without a word. Well, this could have gone worse.
\C[10]He attacks you!\C[0] You avoid his \V[865]
and dash away into the darkness.
You decide to give him a little time to process this before
you speak to him again, so you shift to the following day.
You wish you could speak, tell people not to be afraid.\. But \C[5]your
tongue is useless now.\C[0] It's not even attached to anything. It's
just loose, \C[14]floating around in the void\C[0] with all of your other
obsolete organs.
He keeps avoiding you for days.
He notices you and approaches.
Portrait_PlayerSil
Are you a friend?
You nod. \C[3]Yes.\C[0] I am definitely a friend.
Portrait_PlayerSil
Do you need help?
Maybe you do need help. You are so\..\..\.. \C[5]overwhelmed.\C[0] You don't
know how he could help you, but let's see what happens.
He asks if you want any food.\. You do have half of a sandwich,
but that isn't much.\. \N[1] really is \C[3]awfully kind.
He asks a few things, but doesn't really have \C[14]anything to
offer.
The following day, you give him a little scare by getting
too close, so you decide to \C[14]give him more space.
endcut/MS6
You give him your tongue. You don't really have a use for it
anymore, and\C[14] maybe he could use a spare.
He refuses to take it. That makes you feel\C[5] sad.
Portrait_Player
Thank you.
You beam with pride that he so \C[3]graciously accepted your gift.
Portrait_Player
Why did you give me this?
\..\..\..you're not entirely sure. It seemed like a good idea at the
time.
Oh, how thoughtful,\C[3] he has a gift as well!
He gives you a gift box with a ribbon. \C[3]How exciting!\C[0] Takes you
back to Christmas time. Should you open it, or should you
leave it closed?
He gives you a \C[3]teddy bear.\C[0] What a thoughtful gift. Tears well
up from an unexpected surge of nostalgia. Things were\C[14] so
simple\c[0] back then.
He gives you \C[3]an urn full of dust.\C[0] You can tell who this was. You
see her entire life stretching before your eyes. You can look
into the future and see when she is forgotten.\C[14] You won't
forget.\C[0] You will treasure her remains.
Oh my! He gives you some \C[3]dirty magazines.\C[0] Do you have a use for
these?!
He gives you a little \C[3]handheld console.\C[0] How thoughtful! Now
you'll have something to do when you're bored.
$dataItems[gVr(880)].name
He gives you\C[3] \V[7]\C[0] in return.
How thoughtful!
You feel so weak. So finite. So lost. You are spread so thin over
all of these moments in time.
You spend \C[14]a hundred years in the void\C[0] coming up with a better
gift to give \N[1]. Something to \C[3]communicate how you feel.\C[0]
You get something the following day.
knife
You give him\C[3] a knife.\C[0] He isn't very nice with you. You decide
to leave him alone.
tonics
You give him \C[3]a tonic.\C[0] That should do the trick. You're sure
he can figure out the rest.
tonics
You give him \C[3]a few tonics. \C[0]That should do the trick. You're sure
he can figure out the rest.
wallet
You take \C[3]a wallet full of cash\C[0] from his pocket 8 years ago.
He needs this money now more than ever.
rose
endcut/MS7
You come to realize that \C[14]he is what you are missing.\C[0] You need
him. You need each other. You are \C[3]incomplete halves\C[0] of
something that could be eternal.
The only gift that makes sense is a \C[3]rose.
You know what you need to do.
You approach \N[1]. He is sleeping. It doesn't take much to
wake him. You don't even move. Just look. \C[14]He feels it.
There is nothing to worry about. He just needs to step inside.
Give you what you are \C[5]both missing.
Close the loop in on itself. Become \C[3]infinite.
He seems like he is about to say something, but\..\..\..
He doesn't.
He crawls inside.\. Perhaps he \C[3]understands.
You take a hold of him in every way that you can. You can
\C[14]never let go.\C[0] He is your light. He keeps you sane. And you will
both \C[3]live forever\C[0] here.
You \C[10]annihilate him\C[0] in the most loving way possible.
Your memory - your experience - of this moment is an \C[3]infinite
feedback loop.
Your body is no longer bound by time or space.
Your mind expands into a universe.
\C[3]You\. have \.become\. a \.god.
When the pain finally comes, it comes all at once.
And \C[10]it never ends.
How does this end?
setAchievement("Misc_LookInside");
